p: Influenza pandemic continues to be a major concern throughout the world. During the first half of 2017, India saw an increase in morbidity and mortality rates caused by influenza A virus ( 1, 2). There has been a drastic change in the seasonality of occurrence, with major outbreaks in the dry, hot summer months ( 3 â€“ 5). Adequate surveillance data are not available in the public domain to make detailed assessments of the trends in circulation. The genetic variation which made this possible also remains to be elucidated.
